Key Match Events: Syria took the lead through Mahmoud Alaswad after superb play from Daleho Irandust down the right and some meek Indian defending which let him go through easily.
Syria scored two goals on the counter-attack in the second half.
Pablo Sabbag scored the third goal through a clinical break after India poured men forward in search of that elusive goal.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu was forced into a save from a close-range shot taken by Noah Shamoun, and then Syria hit the bar as well through Irandust.
India finished the match with 18 shots, four more than Syria and more possession than their opponents as well.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Manolo Marquez said he was angry with the first half, and didn't like teams who are scared. He also said he liked how his team played in the second half, which was completely different from the first.
Marquez said that the 3-0 scoreline wasn't an accurate reflection of the game, and that India deserved at least a goal for their efforts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India are yet to register a win in this calendar year.
India will take some positives from this performance, despite the scoreline.
India grew into the game eventually, and especially in the second half, they managed to create chances and force Syrian goalkeeper Elias Hadaya into a couple of excellent saves.
Others: Syria win Intercontinental Cup after dominant 3-0 win over India.
India's lack of goals remains a problem for the side.
